thread.title: "Why is Kris Jenner hosting the Grammys red carpet?" Momager's presenting skills slammed by viewers
thread.title_full: "Why is Kris Jenner hosting the Grammys red carpet?" Momager's presenting skills slammed by viewers

author: Zoe Shenton
title: "Why is Kris Jenner hosting the Grammys red carpet?" Momager's presenting skills slammed by viewers
text:
"Why is Kris Jenner hosting the Grammys red carpet?" Momager's presenting skills slammed by viewers The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star was a guest host ahead of Sunday's annual ceremony Share Viewers weren't impressed with Kris' presenting skills Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Kris Jenner has taken up hosting duties for E! on the red carpet ahead of the 59th annual Grammy Awards. 
The reality momager extraordinaire, who was looking as glamorous as ever in an embellished black dress with sheer panels, joined Fashion Police host Brad Goreski to greet fellow stars and run through some of the best looks from past ceremonies. 
But while some viewers at home praised her hosting skills, others weren't as kind. 
"Can E! please stop letting Kris Jenner host red carpet events... she just ain't got it," one wrote. (Photo: Rex Features) 
"Kris Jenner on @redcarpet is like watching #seanspicer during White House press briefings. Really bad. Get someone good, e," sand another. 
And: "Watching Kris Jenner host the #Eredcarpet show is kind of painful." 
The awards show is taking place at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, and the industry's biggest names - including Beyonce (and twins!), Adele and Justin Bieber - will be in attendance. Read More What time are the Grammy Awards 2017 and how can I watch it in the UK? All you need to know about who is nominated and who is performing 
A number of stars will also take to the stage for special performances, including Katy Perry who will debut her new single. 
The Late Late Show host James Corden - famous for his Carpool Karaoke skits - will host the 59th annual Grammy Awards. He replaces LL Cool J who hosted the prestigious Awards ceremony for the five years in a row.
